DataElement.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation And/Or Cellular Therapy Recipient Research Activity Data Approach Consent Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The month, day, and year of approach to consent to submit research data.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation And/Or Cellular Therapy Recipient Research Activity Data Approach Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy._A person who gets something._Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered._A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn._The act of making contact in order to propose, request, or suggest something._Permission to do something.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation And/Or Cellular Therapy
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.

Concepts.definition: Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
Utilization of specific cells, modified or not, for treatment of diseases. Donor lymphocyte infusion is a type of cellular therapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: A person who gets something.:Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.:The act of making contact in order to propose, request, or suggest something.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.
A collection or single item of factual information, derived from measurement or research, from which conclusions may be drawn.
The act of making contact in order to propose, request, or suggest something.
